question: In the analysis of III group basic radicals of salts, the purpose of adding <katex>$NH_{4}Cl_{(s)}$</katex> to <katex>$NH_{4}OH$</katex> is:
choices: To increase the concentration of <katex>$OH^-$</katex> ions.
To precipitate the radicals of group IV and V.
explanation: Adding <katex>$NH_4Cl$</katex> suppresses the ionization of the weak base <katex>$NH_4OH$</katex> due to the common ion effect (<katex>$NH_4^+$</katex>). This lowers the <katex>$OH^-$</katex> concentration sufficiently to precipitate only Group III hydroxides (which have very low solubility products) without precipitating higher group cations.
